column11: 'Products - Liferay Portal - Collaboration Suite - Page Header'
column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="page-name" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Liferay Collaboration Suite]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="page-description" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
</root>'

' Features

Take advantage of a virtualized work environment with Liferay’s built in Collaboration Suite. This collection of collaboration tools comes prebundled with Liferay Portal.

  • Mail – Send mail directly from your portal. A full AJAX-based webmail client can be configured to interface with many popular IMAP email servers.
    • Microformat Support – Transfer your calendar and user information via Web 2.0 standards. Liferay portlets offer data in microformats (hCard
column15: etc) to be easily used by and integrated with third-party applications (Yahoo
column17:
etc.).
  • Address Book – Manage your contacts within the Liferay Portal.
  • Shared Calendar – Community-based calendars with task list can be used to keep track of group-based events.
    • Calendaring Support –  Import and export  events from  the Calendar Portlet. Liferay supports iCal and Exchange.
  • Blogs – Features include RSS support
column23:
.
  • A Blog Aggregator portlet groups together all blog entries in the entire portal or in a particular organization.
  • Check out Liferay''s own Blogs!
  • Message Boards –  Includes support for sticky posts
column25: recent posts
column26: RSS
column30:
and full fine-grained permissions.
  • Enterprise Instant Messenger – AJAX enabled Jabber client allows users to add “buddies” based on existing portal user accounts. Chat windows persist across portal pages.
  • RSS – Subscribe to frequently read RSS feeds from message boards and blogs within the portal.
  • Wikis – Collaborate on collective knowledge with Liferay’s built-in Wiki
column31:
with versioning and reversion capabilities.
  • Tagging – Use tagging to dynamically share important or interesting content with other portal users.

    •  

    See Full Portlet List

    ]]> '
column32: 'general'

column13:
' Portlet Creation Contest!
August 7 - September 7
column16:
is hosting a portlet creation contest through the month of August!

Entrants can win up to $1000 for their portlet submissions in several categories.  Prizes and categories include:

  • $1000 for the Best Enterprise Portlet
  • $1000 for the Best Integration/Mashup Portlet
  • $500 for the Most Entertaining Portlet
  • $500 for the Best Concept for a Portlet

Best Enterprise Portlet
Create a portlet that adds business value to an enterprise. What would an IT manager want included in their solution? Answer that question
column17:
and you could win $1000.

Best Integration/Mashup Portlet
Create a portlet that integrates with a third-party application such as MS Exchange or CRM. Examples include the Google Map integration already within FireScope.

$500 Most Entertaining Portlet
Use your imagination and create a fun portlet that can be entertaining and engaging for users of all levels.

$500 Best Concept
This award goes to the overall best concept. Whether it accommodates the needs of an enterprise or incorporates a third party as a mashup (or both!) – this award will be given to the portlet with the most original use and content.


CONTEST RULES:
Submitted portlets can be written in Java
column19:
and MUST be able to run on Liferay 4.3!
Check out Liferay for detailed development documentation and other resources.

Submit your portlets to portletcontest@firescope.com in a zipped file. Make sure to read the Porlet Contest Rules and sign the waiver before entering.



ABOUT FIRESCOPE:
FireScope
column20: Inc. offers a single solution that provides a real-time view of the health of IT operations by collecting and processing security
column21: performance and availability data from nearly any server
column23: security point solution or other networked device. It’s built from multiple industry-proven open-source programs and integrated into an easy to use
column24: Web-based dashboard. Solution options range from 20 monitored devices to thousands
column25: making FireScope a product that can be tailored for businesses of any size. FireScope
column26: Inc. is headquartered in Huntington Beach
column28: and provides organizations with actionable business intelligence concerning the health and security of all critical IT assets
column29:
regardless of operating system or platform with its FireScope line of security appliances.

Products at a glance:
The FireScope line of IT Operations Management appliances represent a new way to approach effective security. By blending the best open source technology with an intuitive user interface
column30:
FireScope delivers actionable business intelligence about your infrastructure without the need to consult multiple security point applications and raw system logs.

For more information about how Firescope uses Liferay
column31:
please email events@liferay.com.

]]> '

' By supporting OpenSearch
column14:
search engines can more efficiently access information on your public website.  Specific portlets can now provide OpenSearch content for the portal to published.

]]> '

column13:
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1544&t=1200938499288 The Calendar portlet now supports the standard protocols for calendar data exchange: hCalendar Microformat and iCalendar.  This allows for easier coordination of appointments and event planning.

]]> '
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1570&t=1201031839675 All data is persisted using Hibernate and is called through the POJO implementations. Previously
column14:
Liferay used CMP technology to achieve persistence. Hibernate is now used because of its raw speed and flexibility. Liferay is database agnostic and can run on a variety of popular databases.

]]> '

column13:
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1574&t=1201031859391 You can hot deploy any JSR-168 compliant portlet. This means you can provide more functionality to your end users by writing custom portlets or you can deploy portlets purchased from a portlet vendor.

]]> '

' /image/journal/article?img_id=1523&t=1201031882811 Asynchronous JavaScript And XML (AJAX) and JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) are web development techniques supported by Liferay for creating interactive web applications. This allows for small amounts of data to be transmitted behind the scenes so that the entire web page does not have to be reloaded each time the user makes a change.  This gives Liferay increased interactivity
column14: speed and usability.  Liferay also utilizes reverse-AJAX (or Comet) to push content to the browser as opposed to the browser pulling content from the server.  Liferay also generates REST-style JSON Web Services for lightweight
column15:
maintainable code.

]]> '

column13: ' Developed under the Java Community Process (JCP)
column14:
JSR-170 is a Content Repository API for CMS.  The Document Library is currently compliant.

]]> '

column13:
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1575&t=1201031925579 Liferay Portal supports JavaServer Faces. Via a visual development environment you can develop custom JSF portlets using the "rapid user-interface development" style that JSF promises.  Use any JSF implementation of your choice.  We have examples of portlets in JSF implementations by Sun and Apache MyFaces.

]]> '
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1553&t=1201031947905 Liferay''s Document Library now supports Web-based Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) to manipulate files.  Now
column14: if a user wants to add or delete a file
column15:
he or she can use their favorite web browser or simply drag-n-drop files within their OS''s standard file explorer. We also support WebDav for the Journal to view and edit structures and templates.

]]> '

column13:
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1573&t=1201031967533 WSRP is a web services standard that allows you to publish portlets from your portal to external portals and allows you to consume portlets in your portal from external portals. This allows you to buy and sell portlet functionality as a service.

]]> '

column13:
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1637&t=1200995477046 Liferay supports the Ruby language using jRuby.

]]> '
' /image/journal/article?img_id=1571&t=1200939993996 Liferay leverages Struts and follows the MVC pattern. Most programmers are already familiar with Struts
column14:
which means your developers will have an easier time of writing portlets in a familiar framework.

The look and feel of the portal can be easily customized and reskinned because the display logic is concentrated in a few template files read by Tiles.

column13: ' /image/journal/article?img_id=1572&t=1200940010714 Velocity is a Java-based template engine.  It currently is being used within portlets

and to design themes.

column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="company-image" type="image">
		<dynamic-content id="297021">/image/journal/article?img_id=1777&t=1196365020156</dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="company-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[www.xuventude.net]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="company-link-name" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Xuventude]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="quote" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p>&quot;Liferay has helped us to the development of a complete information system due to its capability of integration and operativity
column14: and to the facilities of adding new portlets to adjust the behaviour of the system to our users requirements&quot; - Eva M. Iglesias
column15:
eLaboro</p></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p><strong>Organization </strong></p><p>The Xunta de Galicia is the political bureaucracy for the autonomous community of Galicia in Spain. It consists of the president
column17: and the specialized ministers (Conselleiros).</p> <p><strong>Challenge</strong></p> <p>Led by its Young General Direction (Direcci¨®n Xeral de Xuventude) department
column18: the Xunta de Galicia sought out a new way to manage and aggregate an array of youth-targeted information disseminated across various systems and locations. This includes job postings
column19: education-related and recreation related information. The department had an older web portal in place but it was very limited without the ability to integrate the different sources of content.&nbsp;</p> <p>Given these difficulties
column20: the organization began to shop around for a replacement. A number of open source solutions were considered
column24: Liferay Portal was ultimately selected for its collaboration and content management capabilities as well as for its ease of integration and customization.</p> <p><strong>Resolution</strong></p> <p>Developed by system integrator
column25: <a href="http://www.elaboro.es" target="_blank">eLaboro</a>
column26: Xuventude.net is a complete information system built on top of Liferay Portal. It allows geographically dispersed users to search for content (job listings
column29: cultural opportunities and more) contributed by different public and private institutions that take part in the information system via a custom-built publication work-flow tool.</p><p>The workflow publication tool acts as a common agenda
column30: coordinating the different users involved in the publication process. Based on Java technology it will run in any Java based application server and any SQL database (The client uses SQL Server 2005) It allows for the assignment and definition of different roles and tasks involved with great possibilities in the definition of work-flow. eLaboro developed the communication interface between the work-flow tool and the different components of Liferay from end-to-end as well as new portlets catering to the organization&rsquo;s requirements.</p> <p>The organization can now define any publication flowchart to be executed by an execution module in any web explorer. This includes the publication of banners and punctual advice and the publication of specific events in a cultural calendar. It also allows users to define any number of user profiles as needed
column31:
each with its own access permissions and operation roles.</p></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="full-image1" type="image">
		<dynamic-content id="297023">/image/journal/article?img_id=297023&t=1196365020162</dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="thumb-image1" type="image">
		<dynamic-content id="297024">/image/journal/article?img_id=1778&t=1196365020182</dynamic-content>

    <dynamic-content><h2>Training Schedule</h2><p><a href="@root_path@/web/guest/services/training/course_topics">Course Topics</a></p><h2>Training Time</h2><p>October 15th - 18th<br />9am-5pm daily</p><h2>Course Details</h2><p>4 days Developer Training<br />$2000 USD</p><h2>Location</h2><p><a href="#link_here">iTrain Training Center</a><br />Wisma MCIS Annexe
column16:
Malaysia<br />(Next to Hilton Hotel Petaling Jaya)</p><h2>Additional Information</h2><p>Please note that a laptop is required for this course.</p><h2>How to Register</h2><p>Email <a href="mailto:sales@liferay.com">sales@liferay.com</a> to register.</p></dynamic-content>
  </dynamic-element>
  <dynamic-element name="main-content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><h2>Overview</h2><p>Liferay will host a public training seminar the week of October 15th - 18th (Mon-Thurs) in Kuala Lumpur
column17: Malaysia. Core topics that will be covered include architecture
column19: content management and themes.</p><p>You will learn how to develop using the extension environment
column20: the patterns you need to know to debug through the source code
column21: auto-generation of the service and persistence layer and more.</p><p>The training seminar will be for 4 days to allow for more in-depth coverage of topics such as core development using Struts and modular development using portlet WARs.</p><h2>NEW 4.3 Release</h2><p>Come and learn about the new features Liferay Portal 4.3 has to offer!</p><h2>Hands-On Training</h2><p>We will take you through the entire process of portlet development and teach you industry best practices. You will learn how to code the action class
column24: and perform database operations.</p><h2>Subject Matter Experts</h2><p>The course will be led by the Liferay experts who designed the software.</p><h2>Development Environment</h2><p>For development we will setup Tomcat on Eclipse and use MySQL for the database. Although Liferay can be used with any application server and database
column25: the above setup is the fastest in terms of development. We may also touch upon installation with other application servers and databases as well.</p><h2>Prerequisites</h2><p>Basic knowledge of Java and Servlets is required. The course will be intensive
column26: but we will make sure to answer any questions you have to ensure that you have a solid grasp of the technology by the end of the course.</p><p>Please note that a laptop is required for this course.</p><ul><li>Minimum System Requirements: 1.4 GHz 512MB RAM</li><li>Recommended System Requirements: 2.0 GHz 1GB RAM</li><li>Wireless Card Required</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><h2>Contact Us</h2><p>Email us at <a href="mailto:sales@liferay.com">sales@liferay.com</a> to register or if you have any questions.</p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

	<dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><div align="center"><p><strong>LIFERAY POWERS</strong><br /> <strong>NEW SPRINGSOURCE WEBSITE </strong><br /><em> Makers of Spring Framework <br /> Leverage Portal Features</em></p></div> <p><strong>LOS ANGELES &ndash; (November 27
column16: provider of the world&rsquo;s leading enterprise-class open source portal
column17: announced that it is powering the new website for SpringSource
column19: the leading Java&trade; and Java EE&trade; application framework. Formerly called Interface21
column20: SpringSource launched www.springsource.com on the latest version of Liferay Portal as part of its company rebranding efforts.</p> <p>&ldquo;A strong online presence is essential to an open source business
column22: VP of Marketing at SpringSource. &ldquo;The new website is a strategic extension of our product offering that will help us to better serve and interact with our community of users.&rdquo;</p> <p>SpringSource has helped hundreds of organizations
column23: including some of the world&rsquo;s largest financial institutions and public sector clients
column24: build and deploy mission-critical applications that boost developer productivity and increase enterprise ROI. Spring Framework&rsquo;s wide user community can now access a nimble
column25: content friendly site powered by Liferay Portal with variable layers of functionality and levels of access.</p> <p>In particular
column26: Liferay Portal&rsquo;s permissioning system gives SpringSource&rsquo;s visitors varying levels of access to the site. For example
column27: user level access to whitepapers (and other content) can be dynamically granted through webforms based on a user&rsquo;s entries.</p> <p>SpringSource is also using Liferay&rsquo;s dynamic virtual hosting feature to power multiple domains on the same instance of Liferay. Each domain is able to have a unique look and set of capabilities
column28: giving a company great flexibility in extending its community and business. &ldquo;Liferay Portal&rsquo;s features allow us to be very creative in the way that we maximize our online presence
column29: &rdquo; said Schott.</p> <p>&ldquo;We are very excited that SpringSource is leveraging Liferay not just to power a site but to help build the developer and user community around its product
column31: Liferay&rsquo;s Chief Software Architect. &ldquo;Spring Framework is a key component of Liferay Portal
column32: and we certainly consider ourselves a member of that community.&rdquo;</p> <p>Deployed at enterprises worldwide in a variety of use cases
column33: Liferay Portal addresses business needs that far exceed those of a typical public facing website. For more information and an online demo
column35: Inc. is the provider of Liferay Portal
column36: the world&rsquo;s leading enterprise open source portal framework with Fortune 500 clients world-wide. Liferay Professional Services offers technical support
column37: custom development and professional training to ensure successful deployment of its flagship product in the most demanding IT environments. The company is headquartered in Los Angeles. For more information
column38: please visit www.liferay.com.</em></p> <p><em><strong> About SpringSource. </strong><br /> SpringSource is a leading provider of trusted open source software for mission-critical enterprise applications. SpringSource created and sustains the development of the Spring Framework
column39: the leading Java&trade; and Java EE&trade; application framework. Through the Spring family of products

column41: including some of the world&rsquo;s largest financial institutions and public sector clients

column43: please visit www.springsource.com.</em></p> <p align="center">----</p> <p>PRESS CONTACT: <br /> Tony Keller <br /> S&amp;S Public Relations

    <dynamic-content><h1><a name="company_intranet"></a>Company Intranet</h1> <p>Liferay Portal provides the tools needed to give your people secure access to senstive company information and applications. Liferay not only helps you manage groups within your organization (ie
column17: it also ensures that individuals within those groups only see what they''re allowed to see. Meanwhile
column18: a Liferay administrator can get applications and content to the whole portal community quickly and easily without having to maintain several different sites.</p> <p><strong>Intranet Story: </strong><a href="@root_path@/web/guest/stories/goodwill">Goodwill Industries</a> used Liferay to build its intranet site

    <dynamic-content><h1><a name="infrastructure_portal"></a>Infrastructure Portal</h1> <p>One of the key uses of a portal is to serve as a framework for aggregating content and applications. The right tools and software will make it easy for developers to make new and existing enterprise applications available&nbsp; in the&nbsp; secure
column14: manageable framework that a portal provides.</p> <p>Liferay Portal offers comprehensive tools to help developers integrate enterprise assets with an integrated enterprise service bus (ESB)
column20: and developer tools such as Liferay''s Eclipse plug-in manager and Liferay Service Builder.</p> <p>Liferay''s Content Interaction API is designed to create a unified interface for working with content in Liferay Portal regardless of source. Users can manage and publish content from third-party systems like Alfresco
column23: or Vignette with the same interface used for Liferay''s built-in content managment system (CMS).</p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><h1><a name="corporate_extranet"></a>Corporate Extranet</h1><p>Liferay Portal helps organizations create secure client- or partner-facing websites (&quot;extranets&quot;).</p><p>For example
column14: a supplier of aftermarket automobile parts may work with several retail resellers that need to access the company''s inventory to order parts and check shipment status. Liferay makes it easy to manage each reseller''s access rights
column17: and quickly create branded extranets for new resellers.</p><p><strong>Extranet Story: </strong><a href="@root_path@/web/guest/stories/educamadrid">EducaMadrid</a>
column21: implemented Liferay as its framework application for an extranet of educational websites.</p></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

<root>
  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><h1><a name="content_management_web_publishing"></a>Content Management &amp; Web Publishing</h1> <p>The ever increasing volume of digital content we deal with on a daily basis makes effective content management systems (CMS) a vital part of any organization. In fact
column14: content management is a natural fit for a portal because of the need for secure access and permissions (ie
column15: who should be able to delete a document from the system?)
column22: publish).</p> <p>Document management is also more effective when repositories can be assigned to different departments and groups within the company.</p> <p><strong>CMS/Web Publishing Story: </strong>The <a href="@root_path@/web/guest/stories/csmonitor">Christian Science Monitor</a> used Liferay to deliver a more dynamic and interactive user experience for its online news site
column24: and better control work flow.</p> <p><strong>CMS/Web Publishing </strong><strong>Story: </strong><a href="@root_path@/web/guest/stories/pantech">Pantech</a>
column25: the seventh largest handset manufacturer in the world
column26: chose Liferay to build its US &amp; Canadian websites to quickly adapt to the existing look &amp; feel of its branding and provide language localization into Spanish and French.</p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><h1><a name="collaboration"></a>Collaboration</h1> <p>The internet enables individuals to collaborate in unprecedented ways
column14: and Web 2.0-style websites have pushed the possibilities even further. But in an enterprise environment
column15: the boundless capacity to share and publish information must be governed by the roles
column17: and security considerations unique to each user and department.</p> <p>Liferay Portal helps organize the potential chaos of an unfettered Web 2.0 environment by empowering users with tools such as tagging
column21: and instant messaging within a secure
column22: administrated framework. Liferay gives administrators ultimate control over what people can do
column25: delegable administrator privileges
column26: enterprise taxonomy
column27: and ad-hoc user groups.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Collaboration Story: </strong>The <a target="_blank" href="http://www.ixarm.com/Platform-hub">French Armaments Procurement Agency (DGA)</a> leverages Liferay Portal''s framework&nbsp; and collaboration suite to run its &quot;Espace Partenaire&rdquo; collaborative Platform (EPNG) for the French defense community...</p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column32: the benefits of JSF have not been widely leveraged by portal developers. This relationship addresses the complexities of Ajax development in a portal environment.<br /><br />&ldquo;Without a doubt

column36: allowing the developer to focus on the creative aspects of rich portal development. I expect the partnership and integration between Liferay Portal and ICEfaces to be a major catalyst in boosting JSF adoption in portal environments.&rdquo;</p><p>Most recently

Kofax selected these technologies to build powerful solutions that will fit into any of our customer''s enterprises

Detailed information on using ICEfaces with Liferay Portal is available in Liferay Portal 4.3.0 documentation.<br />&nbsp;<br /><br /><strong>About Liferay:</strong><br />Liferay Portal is the world&rsquo;s leading enterprise open source portal framework with Fortune 500 clients in the U.S. and Europe. Liferay Professional Services offers technical support

  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><p>Like any other J2EE application
column14: the Remote implementation class should do any security and permission checks that you may need; the Local implementation class should contain the business logic that you allow trusted sources to invoke.&nbsp; After you are done
column15: compile your code and you now have a SOA!</p><p>Liferay''s ServiceBuilder has created all the necessary files you need for a Service-Oriented Architecture.&nbsp; Rather than hours and hours of tedious copy and pasting

the ServiceBuilder automates all of this in a matter of seconds.&nbsp; You can now spend all that time saved on the place where your expertise should be focused: on the business logic.</p></dynamic-content>

<root>
  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><p>The Liferay portal comes packaged with a powerful tool known as ServiceBuilder to helps developers quickly implement a Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA).&nbsp; Most technologies needed for SOA (Web Services
column16: etc.) require a tremendous amount of files to be written and configured.&nbsp; For any developer
column17: this can quickly become tedious and nurture an environment of copy-and-paste purgatory.</p> <p>Liferay''s ServiceBuilder automates most of this so that you
column19: can focus your energy on your project''s business logic.&nbsp; It only takes three steps to implement a powerful SOA in Liferay.</p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

and you are done!<br /> <br /> Over a dozen files were generated for you for each table you specified.&nbsp; This includes the following types of files:</p> <ul> <li>Spring configuration files and Stubbed Remote/Local service classes</li> <li>SOAP and Tunnel classes; WSDL files and Javascript Web Services methods</li> <li>Data Model classes</li> <li>Hibernate classes and configuration files</li> <li>SQL create and index scripts</li> </ul></dynamic-content>

column25: 'Joe Bloggs'

column17:
and fix any bugs that are found before the actual release.

\n

Benefits for the members of the Advisory Board

\n

Liferay recognizes that the Advisory Board brings great value to our products. Participation also provides a number of benefits to Advisory Board members
column18:
including:

  • Priority Issue Status. Issues identified by Advisory Board members will be expedited for resolution and fixes will be incorporated in the upcoming release (members are of course encouraged to provide patch solutions directly). This means features most important to the members will be addressed first.

  • Confidence that releases will work in your environment. Because members are testing features and deployment combinations most important to them
column19:
they can in turn help guarantee a better product for their clients or organizations.

  • Semi-private message board category. Members have access to an “Advisory Board” category  to discuss anything related to beta testing and the Advisory Board. Liferay engineers  participate in this forum on a daily basis. Although only members can post to this category
column20:
read access is available to the public so beta testing activity can be monitored.

  • Greater Community Visibility. Advisory Board Members are considered leaders in the Liferay community for greater credibility in the open source marketplace.

    • Benefits for Liferay Portal

    The sheer number of combinations of application servers
column22: and operating systems supported by Liferay Portal makes testing an extremely complicated and time-consuming task. Furthermore
column23: it is not possible to automate these kinds of tests
column24: making the testing process a balancing act between faster time to market and higher build quality. The Advisory Board is an invitation for community members and customers to help us narrow the gap between quality and innovation
column25:
so that:

  • More bugs are found before the release of the new product
column26:
which produces a more stable product

  • Liferay Portal is tested in real environments rather than in simulated environments

  • Release cycles are shortened and deadlines are met

  • The Liferay community grows in collaboration and participation

  • Features are well-implemented to work in a larger variety of environments

  • End users get access to Liferay engineers to resolve problems quickly

We are excited about this program and look forward to working more closely with our customers and members of our community!

How To Become A Member

Membership in the Advisory Board is by invitation only and based on one''s credibility in the Liferay community. Active participation in Liferay''s ecosystem
column28: and intimate knowledge of Liferay technology are all pre-cursors to candidacy; these can be demonstrated in a commerical or non-commercial context
column31:
or through our partners.

\n

If you believe you qualify for Board membership
column32:
please contact an existing Advisory Board member for recommendation to the Board.

]]>\n \n'
column39: 'Joe Bloggs'

column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root default-locale="en_US" available-locales="en_US">
  <dynamic-element name="company-image" type="image">
    <dynamic-content></dynamic-content>
  </dynamic-element>
  <dynamic-element name="company-link" type="text">
    <dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
  </dynamic-element>
  <dynamic-element name="company-link-name" type="text">
    <dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
  </dynamic-element>
  <dynamic-element name="quote" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content language-id="en_US"><p><em><font size="3">&ldquo;Instead of wasting thousands of euros on commercial licenses
column14: Giste benefited from the advantage of using mature open source software to build a scalable solution on solid technological architecture while cutting expenses.&rdquo; </font></em></p><p align="right">--Victor Fari?a Infante
column16:
Queres Tecnologias</p></dynamic-content>
  </dynamic-element>
  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><p><strong>Company Profile</strong></p><p>Giste Cervecera S.A. is a well known hotel and catering group headquartered in Galicia
column17: Spain.&nbsp; Its presence is mainly in Galicia but is expanding to the rest of Spain with a projected growth of 150% for 2007. In light of this planned expansion
column18: Giste raised the necessity of improving its information management. <br /> System integrator
column19: <a href="http://www.queres.es/" target="_blank">Queres Technologies</a> was selected to assess the possible solutions and build a system to meet these needs. <strong><br /> <br />The Challenge</strong><br />A key problem of small and medium sized companies is the management of information&mdash;inadequate storage leads to difficulties in getting to documents and information contributed by various members of the company. The poor access leads to duplication of information becomes common
column20: which then further exacerbates the already poor storage resources. <br /> <br /> In preparation for its ambitious growth objectives
column21: Giste wanted to improve communication and access to information in order to achieve more streamlined and homogenous business processes across its various locations. Giste was also looking for a single point of access to all corporate resources so that it could progressively provide its employees with human resource services. Some of the identified necessities included:</p><ul><li>A tool that permits notification
column22: resolution and tracking of all the incidences created in the different premises.</li><li>An application for the visualization of payslips that allows the workers to check them in a quick way.</li><li>A tool that would track and monitor corporate expenses.</li><li>A documentation management system that would allow users to share and organize documents.</li></ul><p><strong>Solution</strong><br />Queres Technologies determined that the most fitting solution for Giste&rsquo;s needs would be developed based on JSR-168 standards. Because all applications created (checking of payslips
column23: introduction to extra hours and management of incidences) under these standards would be able to be dropped into and used in any other JSR-168 compliant portal
column24: this development strategy provided the client the greatest degree of flexibility in the long-run. <br /> <br /> After thorough evaluation of various commercial and open source enterprise portal solutions
column25: Queres selected Liferay Portal for its development philosophy and dedication to compliance
column26: the maturity of the product and its forward-looking product roadmap.<br /> <br /> Liferay Portal provided a solid base for future implementations of customized tools&mdash;Its compliance to standards guaranteed the continuity of development done in future evolutions of Liferay. The portal gave Giste a means to standardize and reinforce its corporate values and aims throughout its organization
column27: which ultimately supported employee training.<br /> <br /> Instead of wasting thousands of euros on licenses of commercial applications
column28:
Giste has seen the advantage of using mature open source software to cut expenses and build a scalable solution that has a solid technological architecture.</p></dynamic-content>

'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p align="center"><font size="2"><strong>Liferay and Sygnity Form Services Partnership </strong><br /> <em>Leading Polish Firm Offers Services and<br /> New Banking Solution Using Liferay Portal</em></font></p> <p><strong>LOS ANGELES and WARSAW
column16: provider of the world''s leading enterprise-class
column17: open source portal and content management system announced a new services partnership with Sygnity SA
column18: Poland''s second largest IT services and solutions provider. As a preferred international partner
column19: Sygnity now offers a full range of consulting
column20: and development services around Liferay Portal to its clients in the public and private sectors. Sygnity''s associates will be fully and regularly trained in Liferay Portal technology. It is also now a reseller of Liferay support services.</p> <p>&quot;This relationship highlights the outstanding market adoption of Liferay Portal in Eastern Europe
column22: chief executive officer of Liferay. &quot;We are confident that Sygnity''s local leadership and expertise will be an effective answer to the demand for services around Liferay''s technology.&quot;</p> <p>With over 3000 industry experts
column23: Sygnity (formerly ComputerLand) provides a full range of services
column24: ranging from consulting to outsourcing of IT projects for large and medium-sized companies. Its verticals of expertise include finance
column25: telecommunications
column26: healthcare
column28: Liferay is an oft-requested solution in the thriving and highly competitive business landscape. &quot;The Polish market is a demanding one -- beyond providing agility
column29: an IT solution must also offer a certain degree of security and longevity that will keep organizations in step with their competition
column31: Spokesman of Sygnity SA. &quot;Liferay Portal is flexibility and out of the box functionality caters to growing businesses that need to get up and running quickly but effectively.&quot;</p> <p>In addition to sharing business activities
column32: Sygnity is using Liferay technology to create its own software. The first application developed on Liferay is Demension.CL
column33: an IT solution for the banking sector. The Dimension.CL platform reorganizes and improves existing processes while optimizing and integrating a bank''s operational procedures. The product draws upon Sygnity''s vast experience in the Polish banking sector with plots of clients.</p> <p>&quot;Dimension.CL reduces at least half the time necessary for development and implementation of a new bank product
column36: the Vice-President of The Management Board of Sygnity. &quot;Flexibility and the ability to quickly adapt to market changes are key to having a competitive edge in the financial services sector. These are the advantages our product gained with Liferay technology.&quot;</p> <p>In its eighth year of development
column37: Liferay Portal comes prebundled with a full suite of over 60 enterprise-ready tools for collaboration
column38: content management and organizational administration. Unlike some open source products
column39: it has the backing of a profitable business organization that steers development strategy and offers business-class product support and training as part of a full suite of professional services. Liferay Portal boasts one of the most mature and active communities within the open source portal space and is positioned as a compelling solution in terms of both technological maturity and business longevity.</p> <p>For more about Liferay Portal
column40: visit http://www.liferay.com/. Additional information about Sygnity can be found at http://www.sygnity.pl/.</p> <p><em><strong>About Liferay:</strong></em></p> <p><em>Liferay Portal is the world''s leading enterprise open source portal framework with Fortune 500 clients in the U.S. and Europe. Liferay Professional Services offers technical support
column41: custom development and professional training to ensure successful deployment of its flagship product in the most demanding IT environments. Liferay clients include Discovery Education
column42: Goodwill Industries
column43: and the Christian Science Monitor. The company is headquartered in Los Angeles. For more information
column44: please visit http://www.liferay.com/.<br /></em></p> <p><em><strong>About Sygnity SA:</strong></em></p> <p><em>Sygnity was created through combination of competencies of ComputerLand and Emax companies
column45: bringing new quality into the Polish IT market. The Company offers its own solutions
column46: supplemented by renowned products and technologies. It provides full range of services: from consulting
column47: through implementation to outsourcing of IT projects for large and medium enterprises and the most important sectors of economy and public administration units. Sygnity is the second biggest IT company group in Poland
column48: employing over 3000 experts with thorough IT knowledge and sector specialists
column49: who observe and analyze development of key sectors of Polish economy
column50: as well as international trends. Group consists at the moment of more than ten companies in Poland and abroad. THE biggest are: ARAM -- realizing IT projects for public administration
column51: Projekty Bankowe Polsoft -- software producer for banking and finance sector and software testing center
column52: WINUEL -- producer of solutions for energy sector.<br /></em></p> <p><em>For more information
column53: please visit http://www.sygnity.pl/</em></p></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

    <dynamic-content><![CDATA[Component-oriented user interface frameworks such as JavaServer Faces (JSF) are growing in popularity

column12: '3.    LifeRay Portal: A enterprise class portal framework distributed under the business friendly MIT License. This is a very impressive portal framework that is fully capable of competing with IBM''s WebSphere Portal. What stands out the most is its application server independence. If ANYONE is evaluating open source portal solutions this MUST be considered. LifeRay Portal is even used for the LifeRay.com website...talk about eating your own dog food. Check out the demo here. Cool stuff.'

column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="company-image" type="image">
		<dynamic-content></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="company-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[http://www.pricip.org/ea-portal/web/guest/home]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="company-link-name" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[East West Center - PRICIP Event Anatomy Portal]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="quote" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p>&ldquo;I would really like to thank all the folks who helped us with the development of the Liferay powered portal&mdash;The <a target="_blank" href="http://the.honoluluadvertiser.com/article/2007/Oct/18/ln/hawaii710180348.html">response</a> to our portal has far exceeded expectations.&rdquo; &ndash; Uday S. Kari
column15:
NOAA</p></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p><strong>Organization </strong></p> <p>The <a target="_blank" href="http://www.eastwestcenter.org/">East West Center</a> (EWC) is an education and research organization established by the U.S. Congress in 1960 to strengthen relations and understanding among the peoples and nations of Asia
column18: it has acted as an institutional incubator for the <a href="http://www.noaa.gov/" target="_blank">National Oceanic &amp; Atmospheric Administration</a> (NOAA) IDEA Center. NOAA is a US government funded organization that runs the national weather agency and climate services. Its IDEA Center aims to strengthen the delivery of data products and information services to the Pacific Island user community via data integration activity. The Center is tasked with developing novel
column19: state of the art technologies to demonstrate the various ways of how to deliver information and make these various means as a prototype for NOAA as a whole.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Challenge </strong></p> <p>The <a target="_blank" href="http://www.pricip.org/">Pacific Region Integrated Climatology Information Products</a> (PRICIP) project was undertaken by the East West Center to study patterns of storm frequency and intensity. Its objective was to develop a suite of integrated information products that would help decision-makers in coastal communities plan for and respond to inclement weather conditions by providing timely access to accurate information. The solutions would benefit key sectors including water and natural resource management
column22: and recreation and tourism.</p> <p>Seeking to manage content from several different departments
column23: the East West team realized that it needed a portal that could do more than simply publish content on a webpage. It also had to aggregate content from disparate sites and make sure it would be fully customizable by the user community around it. Because the East-West Center is an incubator of new innovations and tools for a much larger organization
column24: any solution or technology that it invests in must be standards based and scalable.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Resolution </strong></p> <p>After evaluating both commercial and open source solutions
column25: Liferay Portal was chosen for its ability to meet organizational needs while saving both time and funds. Being the only portal that runs in practically any IT environment (any application server
column26: operating system and database) choosing Liferay meant that the team could implement quickly. Its prepackaged themes and tools also cut down on development time while industry standard compliance allowed them to easily develop and integrate its own tools.</p> <p>As part of the initial build out
column27: PRICIP is using Liferay Portal to run a set of historical storm &ldquo;<a target="_blank" href="http://www.pricip.org/ea.php">event anatomies</a>&rdquo;. These event anatomies are web enabled using Liferay Portal and report on the socioeconomic impact that a particular extreme weather event has had on specific sectors. A primary purpose is to familiarize users with in-situ and remotely sensed products typically employed to track and forecast weather and climate. Additional event anatomies for other weather events will be rolled out over coming years as resources permit.</p> <p>Liferay Portal provides personalization
column29: and content aggregation while acting as a web server for the presentation layer of the information systems. It also offers sophisticated personalization features for customized content whereby portal home pages may have different sets of portlets that render content relevant to a user or business situation. Now
column30: event anatomies reduce vulnerability to the economic
column31: social
column32: and environmental risks associated with storms and inclement weather (and correspondingly enhance resiliency).</p> <p>The Event Anatomy portal was configured
column33: with the help of Liferay engineers to seamlessly merge the new portal within the legacy static website
column34: thus maximizing the functionality within a single server. Looking forward
column35:
Liferay will be hosting a number of other event anatomies at EWC in the coming year.</p></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="full-image1" type="image">
		<dynamic-content id="351011">/image/journal/article?img_id=351011&t=1199395607314</dynamic-content>

<root default-locale="en_US" available-locales="en_US">
  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content language-id="en_US"><p><span id="10097_PRODUCT-INTRO_1.0" class="journal-content-article"><strong><a href="../../../../../web/guest/products/journal">Liferay Journal</a> </strong>is Liferay Portal''s built-in content management system (CMS)<span id="10097_PRODUCT-INTRO_1.0" class="journal-content-article"><span class="journal-content-article" id="10097_17171_1.0"> ready to deliver portal-based web publishing and document management.</span></span> A good content management system can significantly reduce the operating cost of publishing
column15: and maintaining web content and document libraries. <span class="journal-content-article" id="10097_17171_1.0">Minimize the cost and complexity of enterprise content management with this out of the box portlet suite.</span> <ul> <li>Separation of content from layout</li> <li>Document library
column17: image gallery</li> <li>Roles-based permissioning and workflow</li> <li>Publishing workflow
column21: and WYSIWYG editing for end-users</li> <li>Page staging</li> </ul> </span></p></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

This collection of collaboration tools comes prebundled with Liferay Portal.</p><ul><li>Microformat Support &ndash; Transfer your calendar and user information via Web 2.0 standards. Liferay portlets offer data in microformats (hCard
column15: etc) to be easily used by and integrated with third-party applications (Yahoo
column17:
etc.).</li><li>Calendaring Support &ndash;&nbsp; Import and export&nbsp; events from&nbsp; the Calendar Portlet. Supports iCal and Exchange.</li><li>Meta-Tagging Support &ndash; Use Liferay&rsquo;s tagging functionality with Liferay&rsquo;s CMS portlets to dynamically share important or interesting content with other portal users.</li></ul></dynamic-content>

'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
  <dynamic-element name="content" type="text_area">
    <dynamic-content><p><style type="text/css"> .about-us-chart { border-collapse: separate; height: 530px; border: 0px none; margin: 0 auto; padding: 0; } .about-us-chart .au-top { height: 75px; padding: 0 15px; border-bottom: 1px solid #161E27; } .about-us-chart .au-content { padding: 0 15px } .about-us-chart td { background: #0E1319 url(@root_path@/image/image_gallery?img_id=1534) no-repeat top left; padding: 0; margin: 0; border: 3px solid #141B24; width: 209px; } .about-us-chart h2{ color: #96C0E6; font-size: 20px; font-weight: normal; } .about-us-chart .au-top p { color: #FFFFFF; font-size: 11px; } .about-us-chart .au-content p { color: #96C0E6; font-size: 11px; padding: 0; margin: 5px 0; } .about-us-chart ul { list-style: disc none outside; padding: 0 0 0 1em; } .about-us-chart li { color: #96C0E6; font-size: 11px; } </style></p> <table class="about-us-chart"> <tbody> <tr> <td><div class="au-container"><div class="au-top"><h2>Enterprise.</h2></div> <div class="au-content"><p>Created in 2000 for the non-profit sector
column14: Liferay Portal has since focused its dedication to low TCO and flexibility towards enterprises across all industries.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Designed with high scalability and robust performance in mind
column15: the award winning Liferay Portal is now in its 8th year of development and is the portal platform of choice for organizations worldwide.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Unlike many open source projects
column16: Liferay Portal is backed by a fast growing
column17: profitable company with direction and purpose.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Liferay
column18: Inc. also houses a professional services team with comprehensive hands-on Liferay knowledge and years of consulting experience with Fortune 500 companies.</p></div></div></td> <td><div class="au-container"><div class="au-top"><h2>Open Source.</h2></div> <div class="au-content"><p>Liferay is committed to innovation
column20: and community. We are open source because we believe it is the next step in the evolution of software development.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Accordingly
column21: Liferay is offered under the business friendly MIT license
column24: or distribute it at absolutely no cost.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Today
column25: we have one of the most mature and active communities in the open source realm. We are the most widely downloaded open source portal on the market and&nbsp; boast worldwide adoption across both public and private sectors.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Users are guaranteed a built in international support system and the peace of mind in knowing that we are here to stay.</p></div></div></td> <td><div class="au-container"><div class="au-top"><h2>For Life.</h2></div> <div class="au-content"><p>Liferay is committed to making a difference in the world.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Each month we donate a percentage of our profits to various world causes. In the past
column26: we have contributed to AIDS relief and the Sudan refugee crisis through well-respected organizations such as Samaritan''s Purse and World Vision.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>The desire to help those in need is the heart of our company
column27: and ultimately the reason why we exist.</p></div></div></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></dynamic-content>\n  </dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column12: 'A description about us on the topic of Enterprise.'
column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="header" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Enterprise.]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="readmore-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="bold-description" type="text_box">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="description" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p>Created in 2000 for the non-profit sector
column14: the award winning Liferay Portal now delivers the same low TCO and flexibility to enterprises across all industries.</p> <p>Today
column15: Liferay Portal is in its 8th year of development and is the portal platform of choice for organizations worldwide.</p> <p>Unlike many open source projects
column16: it is backed by a fast growing
column20: which&nbsp; also houses a professional services team with comprehensive hands-on product knowledge.</p></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="header" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Open Source.]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="readmore-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="bold-description" type="text_box">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="description" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p>Liferay is committed to the spirit of Open Source and offer innovation and reliability thanks to one of the market''s most active and mature communities.</p><p>Our products are offered under the business-friendly MIT license
column16: or distribute Liferay at absolutely no cost.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>This has been a key driver of our solid adoption by the developer community and the acceptance by enterprises as&nbsp; the de-facto portal platform across the world.</p></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column12: 'A description about us on the topic of For Life.'

	<dynamic-element name="description" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><p>Liferay was founded with a purpose beyond revenues and top-line growth.</p> <p>Each month we donate a percentage of profits to a number of worthy causes decided upon by our own employees. In the past we have made financial contributions toward AIDS relief and the Sudan refugee crisis through well-respected organizations such as Samaritan''s Purse and World Vision.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>This desire to impact the world community is the heart of our company
column14: and ultimately the reason why we exist.</p></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column12: 'A brief over view of Licensing benefits of Liferay vs. closed source portals.'
column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="header" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Liferay vs. Closed Source Portals]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="readmore-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="bold-description" type="text_box">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="description" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><ul> <li><strong>Innovation </strong>- In its 8th year of development
column14: Liferay boasts a history of innovation among both commercial and open source products.</li> <li><strong>Low TCO </strong>- Liferay provides the lowest total cost of ownership with ZERO license fees under the <a target="_blank" href="http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php">MIT license</a>.</li> <li><strong>High ROI </strong>- Use your existing IT investment! There is no application server agenda and no pressure to pay for toolsDevelop portlets with a full featured IDE like Eclipse
column16: and JBuilder or with lightweight editor like EditPlus
column18: and Emacs.</li> <li><strong>Freedom &amp; Flexibility</strong> - Open source means the code is in your hands. If you want to customize it
column19: you <em>can</em>. If there are security flaws
column20: the community can participate in fixing it quickly.</li> <li><strong>Security </strong>- There is actually <em>less</em> risk in going with a sustained open source product than in going with a commercial vendor. Vendors can go out of business. Vendors can merge and render your product dead in the water. A sustained open source product like Liferay Portal has an active community around it that works together.</li> </ul></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

column12: 'A brief over view of Licensing benefits of Liferay vs. open source portals.'
column13:
'<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<root>
	<dynamic-element name="header" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[Liferay vs. Open Source Portals]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="readmore-link" type="text">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="bold-description" type="text_box">
		<dynamic-content><![CDATA[]]></dynamic-content>
	</dynamic-element>
	<dynamic-element name="description" type="text_area">
		<dynamic-content><ul> <li><strong>Market Leadership </strong>- Liferay is the leader in downloads (~40
column14: 000/mo) among ALL open source Java portals.</li> <li><strong>Principle </strong>- Not all open source licenses are created equal! Some require modifications to be contributed if you choose to sell or distribute your product. Some still charge a license fee for commercial use.<br /> Liferay is open source because we believe it is the next step in the evolution of software development and chose the liberal MIT license accordingly.</li> <li><strong>Maturity </strong>- Liferay has one of the most mature and active open source communities as evidenced by our active <a href="http://forums.liferay.com/">forums</a>.</li> <li><strong>Stability </strong>- Aside from our impressive community
column15: there is a real company behind the product driving product development.</li> </ul></dynamic-content>\n	</dynamic-element>\n</root>'

]]> '

column12: 'A list of additional files for Liferay.'
column13:
' Additional Files

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 Dependencies
Unzip and put them in the application server global classpath.
Also see the files to integrate with external systems below for Workflow
column16:
etc.

Application Server Plugins

Geronimo: liferay-portal-geronimo-tomcat-4.3.6.car
Be sure you install liferay-portal-geronimo-derby-pool-4.3.6.car first.

Database Scripts

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 SQL Scripts
Contains scripts for all supported databases. Use:

  • create-minimal-*.sql: deletes any existing data
column18:
creates all necessary tables and indexes and loads the minimal necessary data.
  • create-*.sql:: does the same and additionally loads example data.

    •  

    Alternatives:

    • Liferay Portal 4.3.6 SQL Oracle 9 Dump
    • Liferay Portal 4.3.6 SQL Oracle 10 Dump
    • Geronimo Derby Pool 4.3.6 CAR

     

    Integration with External Applications

    Workflow: liferay-portal-mule-4.3.6.war and liferay-portal-jbpm-4.3.6.war
    Rename as mule-web.war and jbpm-web.war and deploy as a regular web application.

    Workflow: liferay-portal-servicemix-4.3.6.war and liferay-portal-jbpm-4.3.6.war
    Rename as servicemix-web.war and jbpm-web.war and deploy as a regular web application.

    CAS: liferay-portal-cas-4.3.6.war
    rename as cas-web.war and deploy as a regular web application. More information...

    Chat: Follow the Chat installation instructions.

    Files for Developers

    Liferay Plugins SDK 4.3.6
    Development environment for Portlets
column19:
Themes and Layout Templates.

\n

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 Web Services Client
\nJava Stubs for Liferay Services (SOAP
column20:
Spring Remoting).

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 JavaDocs

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 Release Notes

Liferay Portal 4.3.6 Source

]]> '

' Liferay Portal 4.3.6

' Liferay Plugins Software Development Kit

Liferay''s exclusive tool enables developers to easily create their own portlets and themes.

Liferay Installation Wizard

An easy to use windows setup installer with automatic Java SDK detection.

Liferay ServiceBuilder

Liferay''s exclusive tool helps developers get their code enabled for Web Services
column14:
Spring and AJAX so they can focus on writing the business logic.

LiferayPedia Explanation

]]> '

column11: 'Products - Liferay Portal - End User In Mind'
column13:
' Just In Time Portlet Rendering

Portlets load independently as they become ready so users don’t have to wait to start using the portal.

One-Click Look and Feel Change

Graphical user interfaces can be selected by end-users without modifying core code. New themes can be added instantly using Liferay’s Plugin Installer.

WebDAV Support

Users will be more productive managing portal content with:
- Familiar operating system conventions for documents and folders.
- Full support for Windows and Linux

Freeform Portlets / WebOS

An optional free-floating layout that mimics the look and feel of a desktop environment..

Easy AJAX UI

Liferay Portal features a rich user interface that includes - Drag-and-drop portlet re-positioning - Dynamic portlet loader - Portlet stylizer that allows end users to customize colors
column15:
and links without editing stylesheets or HTML

Context-Sensitive Help

Portal users can access information specific to the tool they are using at any given time by clicking on a "question mark" icon.

Liferay Plugins Catalog

This exclusive feature connects to remote portlet and theme repositories and keeps track of new versions and updates. It allows portlets to be instantly updated or rolled back without restarting the server. Portlet providers can leverage this new channel to deliver powerful extensions to Liferay’s capabilities.

]]>\n \n'

column11: 'Products - Liferay Portal - Tech to Help Developer'
column13:
' Standards Compliant

Liferay complies with the JSR-168 and JSR-286 portlet standards
column14:
and can therefore consume any portlets written to these standards.

Ready Integration

Partnerships with organizations such as Alfresco
column17: and Pentaho ensure unparalleled integration and support for these widely-used technologies. Bridges are provided to allow developers to use many popular frameworks
column20:
or Struts to write portlets.

Fine-Grained Permissioning System

Get the right information and application functions to the right people.

A reusable
column21: extensible authorization architecture is used throughout the portal and is applicable to individual portlet elements such as buttons
column23:
portlets and users.

LiferayPedia Explanation

 

Workflow Capability

Reduce the time it takes to update applications to reflect how your business changes.

Easily update processes such as e-commerce checkout
column25: content publishing
column26:
and document approval.

Default installation of jBPM can be replaced with Intalio or other workflow engines.

CSS Compliance

Liferay Portal is coded to CSS standards for simple theme development.

AJAX Interface Tools

Liferay-tailored Javascript client libraries based on jQuery with support for JSON Web Services to help create rich user interfaces.

Themes/Layout Enhancements

- Role-based theme management
- Standardization on jQuery JavaScript Framework
- Simplified theme development process
- Semantic and non-obtrusive markup
- Standards compliance
- LAR Import / Export for Theme

]]>\n \n'
